clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Lactobacillus Reuteri and Nystatin Prophylaxis on Candida Colonization and Infection in Very Low Birth Weight Infants
clinical_study.official_title: Zekai Tahir Burak Maternity Teaching Hospital, Ankara/Turkey

lead_sponsor.agency: Zekai Tahir Burak Women's Health Research and Education Hospital

clinical_study.source: Zekai Tahir Burak Women's Health Research and Education Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Probiotics are favorable microorganisms that regulate the flora of the gastrointestinal system and stimulate the immune system. Lactobacillus reuteri was shown to reduce candida colonization. The objective of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of prophylactic Lactobacillus reuteri in reducing the candida colonization and infection in very low birth weight infants.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of prophylactic Lactobacillus reuteri and nystatin on candida colonization and infection in very low birth weight infants
primary_outcome.description: Rectal and skin swabs for Candida colonization will be taken weekly. Blood culture for Candida infection will be taken weekly.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of Lactobacillus reuteri on feeding intolerance
secondary_outcome.description: Feeding intolerance (gastric residuals in the amount that was more than half of the previous feeding, abdominal distention or heme-positive stools)

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of Lactobacillus reuteri on sepsis
secondary_outcome.description: Patients with culture positivity will accept as proven sepsis.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of Lactobacillus reuteri on length of hospital stay
secondary_outcome.description: Specified length of hospital stay as days.

secondary_outcome.measure: Effect of Lactobacillus reuteri on necrotizing enterocolitis in VLBW infants
secondary_outcome.description: NEC diagnosis will make modified Bell's criteria. Grade 1A will not include in NEC group.

arm_group.description: Lactobacillus reuteri 100 million CFU/day for 3 months

intervention.description: Lactobacillus reuteri 100 million CFU/day for 3 months
50000 unit/3 times a day, both for orally and by orogastric route

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Very low birth weight infants < 1500 gr
- Gestational age < 32 weeks
Exclusion Criteria:
- Genetic anomalies
- Short bowel syndrome
- Not willing to participate
- Allergy to Lactobacillus reuteri components
